cs.IT, cs.SP, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.NA. 

The paper deals with the Compressed Sensing (CS) problem and its solution using Linear Programming (LP), which falls under the Information Theory (cs.IT) and Signal Processing (cs.SP) sub-categories. The paper also discusses the interpretation of the Basis Pursuit (BasP) algorithm as a channel-coding problem, which could be relevant to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category. Additionally, the paper mentions the use of a random input for the error-vector, which could be related to the Numerical Analysis (cs.NA) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the design of an algorithm to discover the sparsest vectors for which the BasP fails, which could be relevant to the Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category.
